An appropriate person is a person who controlled the document referred toin section 52(5) at the time the requirement was imposed.
Restriction on disclosure of information

This section applies if information relating to a particular body or otherperson is obtained by the Auditor General for Wales or an auditor, or by aperson acting on behalf of the Auditor General for Wales or an auditor—
pursuant to a provision of this Part or Part 1 of the Local Government Act[1999 (c. 27)](/id/ukpga/1999/27?view=plain "Go to item of legislation"), or

in the course of an audit, study or inspection under a provision of thisPart, section 145C of the Government of Wales Act [1998 (c.38)](/id/ukpga/1998/38?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") or Part 1 ofthe Local Government Act 1999.
The information must not be disclosed except in accordance with any ofthese—
with the consent of the body or person to whom the information relates;
for the purposes of any functions of the Auditor General for Wales or anauditor under this Part or Part 1 of the Local Government Act 1999;
for the purposes of the functions of the Secretary of State relating tosocial security;
for the purposes of the functions of a Local Commissioner in Wales underPart 3 of the Local Government Act [2000 (c. 22)](/id/ukpga/2000/22?view=plain"Go to item of legislation");
for the purposes of any functions of the Assembly which are connected withthe discharge of social services functions by local authorities in Wales;
in accordance with section 145C(5) or (8) of the Government of Wales Act1998;
for the purposes of any criminal investigation which is being or may becarried out, whether in the United Kingdom or elsewhere;
for the purposes of any criminal proceedings which have been or may beinitiated, whether in the United Kingdom or elsewhere;
for the purposes of the initiation or bringing to an end of any suchinvestigation or proceedings;
for the purpose of facilitating a determination of whether any suchinvestigation or proceedings should be initiated or brought to an end.
A person commits an offence if he discloses information in contravention ofsubsection (2).
A person guilty of an offence under subsection (3) is liable—
on summary conviction, to imprisonment for a term not exceeding six monthsor to a fine not exceeding the statutory maximum or to both;
on conviction on indictment, to imprisonment for a term not exceeding twoyears or to a fine or to both.
In subsection (2) “social services functions” has the same meaning as inthe Local Authority Social Services Act [1970 (c.42)](/id/ukpga/1970/42?view=plain "Go to item of legislation").
The Secretary of State may by order made by statutory instrument amend orrepeal the preceding provisions of this section.
An order under subsection (6) may be made only if—

section 49 of the Audit Commission Act [1998 (c.18)](/id/ukpga/1998/18?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") (restriction ondisclosure of information) has been amended or repealed in the same Session asthat in which this Act is passed or in any later Session;

the Secretary of State thinks that the amendments or repeals to be made bythe order under subsection (6) will (subject to paragraph (c)) have the sameeffect as the amendments to or repeal of section 49 of that Act;
the order would not have the effect of imposing any further restriction onthe disclosure of information under this section.
An order under subsection (6) may not be made unless a draft of the orderhas been laid before, and approved by a resolution of, each House ofParliament.
Supply of benefit information to Auditor General for Wales
The Secretary of State may supply to the Auditor General for Wales anyinformation held by the Secretary of State which—
relates to housing benefit or council tax benefit, and
appears to the Secretary of State to be relevant to the exercise of anyfunction of the Auditor General for Wales.
Publication of information by Auditor General for Wales
The Auditor General for Wales may publish information with respect to anyof these—
the making by an auditor of a report under section 22;
the subject-matter of a report under section 22;
the decision made and other action taken by a body in response to thereceipt of a report under section 22 or to anything in a report under section22;
a contravention by a body of regulations made under section 39;
a contravention by a body of an obligation imposed on the body undersection 47(4).
The information that may be published under subsection (1)(a), (b) or (c)does not include information excluded under section 26(5) from an approvedsummary published under section 26(4)(c).
The Auditor General for Wales must inform a body before publishinginformation under subsection (1) relating to it.

Information published under subsection (1) must be published in any mannerwhich the Auditor General for Wales considers appropriate for bringing theinformation to the attention of members of the public who may be interested init.
Provision of information to Audit Commission

The Auditor General for Wales must, on request, provide the AuditCommission with any information it may reasonably require for the purpose ofmaking comparisons, in the discharge of its functions under sections 33 and 34of the Audit Commission Act [1998 (c. 18)](/id/ukpga/1998/18?view=plain "Go toitem of legislation"), between local government bodies in Wales and otherlocal government bodies.
In this section “local government body” has the meaning given in section53(1) of the Audit Commission Act 1998.
Orders and regulations
Any power conferred on the Assembly by this Part to make orders orregulations is exercisable by statutory instrument.
Any power conferred on the Assembly or the Secretary of State to make anorder or regulations under this Part includes power—
to make such incidental, consequential, transitional or supplementaryprovision as the Assembly or the Secretary of State thinks appropriate;
to make different provision for different cases, including differentprovision for different localities and different bodies and descriptions ofbodies.
Interpretation of Part 2
This section applies for the interpretation of this Part.
“Auditor” in relation to accounts of a body—
means a person appointed by the Auditor General for Wales under section 13to act as auditor of those accounts;
to the extent provided by section 15(3), includes a person assisting anauditor appointed under section 13 under arrangements approved under section15(1).
“The auditor”, if there is more than one auditor, means any one of them(subject to any express provision to the contrary).

“Best value authority in Wales” means a local government body in Waleswhich is also a best value authority for the purposes of Part 1 of the LocalGovernment Act [1999 (c. 27)](/id/ukpga/1999/27?view=plain "Go to item oflegislation").
“Local authority in Wales” means a county council, county borough councilor community council in Wales.
“Local government elector” means a person registered as a local governmentelector in the register of electors in accordance with the provisions of theRepresentation of the People Acts.

A reference to a local government elector for an area, in relation to aNational Park authority which is the local planning authority for a NationalPark, is to a local government elector for any area the whole or part of whichis comprised in the Park.
“Statutory provision” means a provision contained in or having effect underan enactment.
Part 3Welsh NHS bodies
Meaning of “Welsh NHS body”
In this Part “Welsh NHS body” means—
a Local Health Board,
a Special Health Authority performing functions only or mainly in respectof Wales,

a National Health Service trust all or most of whose hospitals,establishments and facilities are situated in Wales or any trustees appointedin pursuance of section 11 of the National Health Service and Community CareAct [1990 (c. 19)](/id/ukpga/1990/19?view=plain "Go to item of legislation")for such a trust, or

a body of trustees appointed in pursuance of section 29(1) of the NationalHealth Service Reorganisation Act [1973 (c. 32)](/id/ukpga/1973/32?view=plain"Go to item of legislation") and section 95(1) of the National Health ServiceAct [1977 (c. 49)](/id/ukpga/1977/49?view=plain "Go to item of legislation")for a trust all or most of whose hospitals, establishments and facilities aresituated in Wales.
Audit of Welsh NHS bodies

The accounts prepared by a Welsh NHS body under section 98(2) of theNational Health Service Act 1977 (accounts of NHS bodies) for a financial yearmust be submitted by that body to the Auditor General for Wales no later thanfive months after the end of that year.
The Auditor General for Wales must—
examine and certify any accounts submitted to him under this section, and
no later than four months after the accounts are submitted to him, laybefore the Assembly a copy of them as certified by him together with hisreport on them.
In examining any accounts submitted to him under this section, the AuditorGeneral for Wales must, in particular, satisfy himself—
that the expenditure to which the accounts relate has been incurredlawfully and in accordance with the authority which governs it, and
that the body to which the accounts relate has made proper arrangements forsecuring economy, efficiency and effectiveness in its use of resources.
Co-operation with Assembly, Audit Commission or CHAI
The Auditor General for Wales must co-operate with—
the Assembly,
the Audit Commission, or
the Commission for Healthcare Audit and Inspection,
where it seems to him appropriate to do so for the efficient and effectivedischarge of his functions in relation to Welsh NHS bodies.
Audit of accounts of officers of Welsh NHS bodies
This section applies where an officer of a Welsh NHS body receives money orother property—
on behalf of that body, or
for which he ought to account to that body.
The officer must keep accounts.
The accounts of the officer must—
be made up each year to 31 March, and
be audited by the Auditor General for Wales,
and section 61 applies with the necessary modifications in relation to theaccounts and audit.
Provision of information by CHAI

The Commission for Healthcare Audit and Inspection must, on request,provide the Auditor General for Wales with any information he may reasonablyrequire for the purpose of making comparisons, in the discharge of hisfunctions under sections 145 and 145A of the Government of Wales Act [1998 (c.38)](/id/ukpga/1998/38?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") in relation toa Welsh NHS body, between the Welsh NHS body and English NHS bodies and cross-border SHAs.

Subsection (1) does not require information to be provided in circumstanceswhere (but for that subsection) the disclosure of the information wouldcontravene section 136 of the Health and Social Care (Community Health andStandards) Act [2003 (c. 43)](/id/ukpga/2003/43?view=plain "Go to item oflegislation") (restriction on disclosure of personal information by CHAI).
In this section “English NHS body” and “cross-border SHA” have the meaninggiven by section 148 of that Act.
Part 4Miscellaneous and general
Miscellaneous
Public bodies subject to audit etc
The Government of Wales Act 1998 is amended as follows.
In section 144 (accounts, audit and reports), after subsection (8) insert—
“(8A)The Assembly may, with the consent of the Secretary of State, by orderamend any of the Parts of Schedule 17 in the manner mentioned in paragraph (a)or (c) of subsection (8).”
In subsection (9) of that section, after paragraph (b) add “and
“public body” means—
a body exercising functions of a public nature, or
a body entirely or substantially funded from public money.”
In Schedule 17, in Part 1 (bodies subject generally to audit etcprovisions), in paragraph 1 omit “(other than the Care Council for Wales)”.
Minor and consequential amendments
Schedule 2 (which makes minor and consequential amendments) has effect.
Functions transferred to Assembly

Any reference in Schedule 1 to the National Assembly for Wales (Transfer ofFunctions) Order 1999 ([S.I.1999/672](/id/uksi/1999/672?view=plain "Go to itemof legislation")) to an enactment amended by this Act is to be treated as areference to that enactment as amended by this Act.
Subsection (1) does not affect the power to make further Orders varying oromitting those references.
Transitional provision
Transfer of property etc to Auditor General
Any property, rights and liabilities which are the subject of a transferscheme are to be transferred to and vested in the Auditor General for Wales inaccordance with the scheme.
For this purpose “a transfer scheme” means a scheme contained in an ordermade under paragraph 1 of Schedule 3.
Schedule 3 (which makes provision about schemes for the transfer ofproperty etc) has effect.
Local government bodies in Wales

Subsection (2) applies where, immediately before the commencement ofparagraph 38(3) of Schedule 2, an appointment of a person as an auditor inrelation to accounts of a local government body in Wales has effect under Part2 of the Audit Commission Act [1998 (c. 18)](/id/ukpga/1998/18?view=plain "Goto item of legislation").
Until the end of the period for which that appointment was made, Part 2 ofthis Act applies, in relation to that body, as if the appointment had beenmade under section 13.
Subsection (4) applies where, immediately before the commencement ofparagraph 38(3) of Schedule 2—
arrangements approved under section 3(9) of the Audit Commission Act 1998have effect;
the arrangements authorise a person to carry out specified functions of anauditor appointed under Part 2 of that Act in relation to accounts of a localgovernment body in Wales; and
the appointment of the auditor in relation to the accounts of that body haseffect under Part 2 of that Act.

Until the end of the period for which the arrangements have effect, or (ifsooner) the end of the period for which the appointment of the auditor wasmade, Part 2 of this Act applies, in relation to that body, as if—
the arrangements had been approved under section 15(1);
the appointment of the auditor had been made under section 13; and
the arrangements authorised the person to carry out functions of theauditor which correspond to the functions of the auditor that he is authorisedto carry out by the arrangements.

Subsection (6) applies where, immediately before the commencement ofparagraphs 23, 24 and 38(3) of Schedule 2, the Audit Commission is promotingor undertaking a study under Part 3 of the Audit Commission Act [1998 (c.18)](/id/ukpga/1998/18?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") in connectionwith a local government body in Wales.
After (and notwithstanding) that commencement, Part 3 of the AuditCommission Act 1998 continues to have effect in relation to the promotion orundertaking of the study.
In this section “local government body in Wales” has the meaning given insection 12(1).
Welsh NHS bodies

Subsection (2) applies where, immediately before the commencement ofsection 61, an appointment of a person as an auditor in relation to accountsof a Welsh NHS body has effect under Part 2 of the Audit Commission Act 1998.

Until the end of the period for which that appointment was made, sections61 and 63 apply, in relation to that Welsh NHS body, as if that person wereauthorised under section 92(8) of the Government of Wales Act [1998 (c.38)](/id/ukpga/1998/38?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") to exercise thefunctions of the Auditor General for Wales under sections 61 and 63.

Subsection (4) applies where, immediately before the commencement ofsection 61 and paragraph 38(2) of Schedule 2, the Audit Commission ispromoting or undertaking a study under section 33 or 35 of the AuditCommission Act 1998 in connection with a Welsh NHS body.
After (and notwithstanding) that commencement, section 33 or, as the casemay be, 35 of that Act continues to have effect in relation to the promotingor undertaking of the study.
In this section “Welsh NHS body” has the meaning given in section 60.
General
Interpretation
In this Act—
* “the Assembly” means the National Assembly for Wales;
* “the Audit Commission” means the Audit Commission for Local Authorities and the National Health Service in England and Wales;
* “body” includes office;
* “financial year” means the 12 months ending with 31 March.
Repeals
The enactments mentioned in Schedule 4 are repealed to the extent specified.
Commencement
The preceding provisions (and the Schedules), except section 71, come intoforce in accordance with provision made by the Assembly by order.
The power to make orders under subsection (1) is exercisable by statutoryinstrument.
Orders under subsection (1)—
may include transitional provision or savings;
may make different provision for different purposes.
Extent
The amendment or repeal of a provision by this Act has the same extent asthe provision amended or repealed.
Subject to that, this Act extends to England and Wales only.
Short title
This Act may be cited as the Public Audit (Wales) Act 2004.

title: Public Audit (Wales) Act 2004
longtitle: An Act to confer further functions on the Auditor General for Wales; to make provision about the audit of accounts of public bodies in Wales and related matters; to make provision about economy, efficiency and effectiveness in relation to public bodies and registered social landlords in Wales; and for connected purposes.
